title: Gary Rowett set for Derby job after agreeing to become Steve McClaren's successor
text:
Sport Gary Rowett set for Derby job after agreeing to become Steve McClaren's successor The Rams have been on the lookout for a new boss since McClaren was sacked for a second time Share Gary Rowett is set to takeover at Derby (Photo: Nathan Stirk) Share Get football     
Gary Rowett is set to become the new manager of Derby . 
The Rams have been on the lookout for a new boss since Steve McClaren was sacked for a second time by the Championship club. 
Derby owner Mel Morris made Rowett the top choice for the Pride Park hotseat and has fended off competition from Norwich for the former Birmingham boss. 
Morris has been impressed by Rowett's work at Burton and the Blues. 
Assistant manager Chris Powell and technical director Chris Evans followed McClaren out the door as part of a large scale shake-up. 
Tech tycoon Morris had intended to conduct a wide-ranging summer review at County but has brought forward his plans. Steve McClaren was axed by the Rams for a second time (Photo: Getty) 
is fuming with many of the club's under-performing stars after sanctioning a large wage bill at well-supported Derby, who have 23,000 season ticket holders. 
MirrorSport understands Abdoul Camara , Matej Vydra , Jason Shackell and Nick Blackman now face likely summer exits. Even former golden boy Will Hughes, who has disappointed this term despite being given a new deal, might be sacrificed. 
Morris wants County to push for a Premier League return next season but cannot pump in millions more of his own cash due to Financial Fair Play rules. 
His cull has included Evans after a bungled January window when they preoccupied themselves failing to bring back Chris Martin from his Fulham loan.
